QuestionText: Which of the following strategies is most effective for differentiated instruction in a diverse classroom?
OptionA: Using uniform lesson plans for all students
OptionB: Encouraging peer tutoring and group work
OptionC: Giving standardized tests to assess learning outcomes
OptionD: Providing identical resources to every student

QuestionText: In Bloom’s Taxonomy, which domain primarily focuses on the emotional aspects of learning?
What is the primary purpose of formative assessment in learning?
OptionB: To guide teaching and learning improvements
OptionD: To assign grades based on their performance

QuestionText: The Right to Education Act, 2009 provides free and compulsory education to children in which age group in India?
Which of the following terms refers to a child’s ability to construct understanding by interacting with their environment?
Which theorist is associated with the concept of social learning through observation?
What is the ideal teacher-student ratio recommended to ensure effective teaching-learning in classrooms?

OptionA: Providing separate classes for special needs students
OptionB: Integrating all students in mainstream schools
OptionC: Creating special schools for the underprivileged

QuestionText: Which teaching method best supports students with different learning styles?
What role does 'reflective practice' play in a teacher’s professional development?
OptionB: Helps improve teaching strategies and effectiveness
OptionC: Eliminates the need for feedback from students
